author: dlr
msg: For 'merge', refine the requested revision range by filtering out
revisions from the merge source which are already reflected in the
Unfortunately, we can't also filter out any merges from target to
source when merging back to target (cyclically), because we can't
easily tell the difference between the result of a merge, and any
local changes, in a single commit.
(calculate_requested_ranges): Add a new function to refine the
calculate_requested_ranges(), and pass it on to
expected merge info to include r7 (the commit of a merge), since we
can't easily filter the result of a merge from any other changes
(test_list): Unmark avoid_mirrored_revs as XFAIL, and rename to
Rewrite "handle reflected revisions" task, and move the remainder of
it to post-1.5.0.  It's looking like it will require fairly
significant changes to Subversion's backend storage to support fast
